title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
creator_contributor_role: United States. Office of Education, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Engineering - Study and teaching
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Engineering - Study and teaching
description: Episode number 2 of Series "Engineering heat treatment of steel". Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
